front.reference: Polish J. of Environ. Stud. Vol. 15 No. 4A (2006), 88-90

docTitle.titlePart:
On the Hydrodynamics of Dimeric Bovine
E-Lactoglobulin Solutions from Viscometry
Approach

byline.affiliation: Department of Biophysics, Silesian Medical Academy,

front.div:
Abstract
The paper presents the results of viscosity determinations on aqueous solutions of dimeric bovine
E-lactoglobulin (BLG) at temperatures ranging from 5 to 55
0
C and for concentrations up to 444 kg/m
3
. The
solutions viscosity has been measured by using an Ubbelohde-type capillary microviscometer. The viscosity-
temperature dependence, at each fixed concentration, has been quantitatively described on the basis
of a modified Arrhenius formula. The effective specific volume, the activation energy and entropy of viscous
flow for hydrated BLG were calculated. The axial ratio and the hydrodynamic volume of dimeric BLG were
established.
front.keyword: Keywords: Viscosity, E-lactoglobulin, Activation energy, Effective specific volume
